title: Andy Murray and his wife Kim expecting their third child ‘as soon as next week’
text:
Andy and Kim are expecting their third child (Picture: Getty Images)

Andy Murray and his wife Kim are expecting their third child.

The British tennis champion revealed the news on Friday, and admitted Kim is due to give birth as soon as next week.

The two-time Wimbledon champion said he may need to rearrange his playing schedule depending on the new arrival.

Kim, 31, sparked pregnancy rumours in July after arriving at Wimbledon wearing a maternity top while cheering on her husband in a mixed doubles match with Serena Williams but the parents of two did not confirm the happy news until Friday.

Obviously the baby can come any time from pretty much next week,’ he said to The Times.

‘I would adjust my schedule if I couldn’t go to Antwerp. My plan is to play Antwerp and then I am done through to the Davis Cup. If the baby came early, I would miss Antwerp and then maybe play at the Paris Masters.’

Andy and Kim are parents to two girls (Picture: Getty Images)

Sir Andy and Kim are already parents to daughters Sophia, three, and Edie, who will turn two next month.

The couple got married in Sir Andy’s home town of Dunblane, Scotland, in 2015.

The couple got married in Sir Andy’s home town of Dunblane in 2015 (Picture: GC)

Sir Andy has just lost a fiery encounter with Italian Fabio Fognini in the second round of the Shangai Masters.

However, the match was overshadowed by a row between the two players, with Sir Andy telling his rival to ‘shut up’ after he felt he was shouting out to put him off in the middle of a point.

Three-time Grand Slam winner Sir Andy is currently ranked number 289 in the world after battling back from a career-threatening hip injury.
